intro: Physaria gordonii subsp. densifolia, commonly known as the denseleaf bluemink, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The species is characterized by its dense, woolly foliage and small, clustered blue or purple flowers. It typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. The plant's morphology reflects its evolutionary adaptation to withstand drought and intense sunlight.
